questions.question: 雨が（　　　）から、出かけるのをやめました。
questions.hint:
雨あめ (ame) – rain
降ったふった (futta) – it rained

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉 『降った』 is the past tense of 'to rain'. This expresses the reason why the person did not go out.

  • 1. 降って – te-form, used for connection
  • 2. 降る – dictionary form (present/future)
  • 3. 降れば – conditional 'if it rains'
  • 4. 降った – ✅ past form, 'it rained'

English Translation: Because it rained, I decided not to go out.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 4. 降った (futta) – it rained
Only the past tense makes logical sense with the reason for not going out.

questions.question: 母は（　　　）ながら料理をしています。
questions.hint:
母はは (haha) – mother
料理りょうり (ryouri) – cooking
ながら – while doing

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉 『うたいながら』 follows the grammar pattern: verb stem + ながら.

  • 1. うたい – ✅ stem form, 'singing'
  • 2. うたって – te-form, incorrect here
  • 3. うたう – dictionary form, not used with ながら
  • 4. うたいます – polite form, not grammatical here

English Translation: My mother is cooking while singing.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 1. うたい (utai) – verb stem
Only verb stems are used before 'ながら'.

questions.question: もうすぐ夏休みが（　　　）ね。
questions.hint:
夏休みなつやすみ (natsuyasumi) – summer vacation
始まるはじまる (hajimaru) – to begin (intransitive)

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉 『始まります』 is the polite present tense of the intransitive verb 'to begin.'

  • 1. 始めます – transitive, 'to begin something'
  • 2. 始まり – noun/stem form
  • 3. 始まって – te-form
  • 4. 始まります – ✅ correct polite present form

English Translation: Summer vacation will begin soon, right?
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 4. 始まります (hajimarimasu)
This is the only correct present-tense form for 'something starting'.

questions.question: 新しい仕事に（　　　）から、毎日が楽しいです。
questions.hint:
慣れてなれて (narete) – got used to
から – since / because

explanation.correct:
Correct! 🎉 『慣れてから』 means 'since getting used to (something)'.

  • 1. 慣れる – dictionary form
  • 2. 慣れない – not get used to
  • 3. 慣れて – ✅ te-form + から = since
  • 4. 慣れます – polite present, not matching 'から'

English Translation: Since I got used to my new job, every day is fun.
explanation.incorrect:
Answer: 3. 慣れて (narete)
'Verb te-form + から' is the correct way to say 'since doing X.'
